content: Educational qualificationThis article includes a list of references, related reading, or external links, **but its sources remain unclear because it lacks inline citations**. Please help improve this article by introducing more precise citations. *(April 2015)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Senior Cambridge** examinations were [General Certificate of Education](/wiki/General_Certificate_of_Education) examinations held in [India](/wiki/India), [Jamaica](/wiki/Jamaica), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan), and [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). They were preceded by the Junior Cambridge and Preliminary Cambridge examinations. ## History ### India The first school in [Delhi](/wiki/Delhi) to offer the Senior Cambridge examination was the Cambridge School at [Daryaganj](/wiki/Daryaganj). After 1972, the Senior Cambridge examinations were largely superseded by the [Indian Certificate of Secondary Education](/wiki/Indian_Certificate_of_Secondary_Education) (ICSE) and the Indian School Certificate (ISC) examinations conducted by the [Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations](/wiki/Council_for_the_Indian_School_Certificate_Examinations) (CISCE), an autonomous body established in 1958. ### Malaysia During the [Japanese](/wiki/Japan) occupation of Malaysia in [World War II](/wiki/World_War_II), pupils who sat their Senior Cambridge examinations at some schools in 1941 had to wait until 1946 to learn their results. It was replaced with the [Sijil Tinggi Persekolahan Malaysia](/wiki/Sijil_Tinggi_Persekolahan_Malaysia) during the late 1970s. ### Pakistan At its independence from British India in 1947, Pakistan inherited a number of schools that offered Senior Cambridge examinations. But one of the first schools to offer Senior Cambridge was Cathedral School Hall Road Lahore. Since then, the number of schools with a Senior Cambridge curriculum expanded greatly, and Cambridge schools are prominent among the premier educational institutions of Pakistan. ### Singapore Prior to the introduction of the [O Levels](/wiki/O_Levels) examinations by [UCLES](/wiki/UCLES), students sat for the Senior Cambridge examinations at the end of their four-year secondary school studies. This is equivalent to the [General Certificate of Secondary Education](/wiki/General_Certificate_of_Secondary_Education) (or GCSE) in England. The Higher School Certificate (HSC) examinations were replaced by [A Levels](/wiki/A_Levels) (roughly equivalent to the present British "[sixth form](/wiki/Sixth_form)") in 1973. ## Subjects ### Textbooks At the Victoria Institution in 1933, the following list of school textbooks was issued to pupils preparing to study for the Senior Cambridge examinations: - *New School Arithmetic* - *Algebra*, Baker and Bourne - *Geometry Parts I - VI* - *Logarithm Tables* - *English Exercises*, [Henry Watson Fowler](/wiki/Henry_Watson_Fowler) - *Expansion of the British Empire* - *Historical Atlas* - *Essentials of World Geography* - *Geography* - *General Course in Hygiene* - *Contouring and Map-Reading*, Bertie Cotterell Wallis - *St Matthew* - *King's I* - *She Stoops to Conquer*, [Goldsmith](/wiki/Oliver_Goldsmith) - *Essay on Sir William Temple*, [Thomas Babington Macaulay, 1st Baron Macaulay](/wiki/Thomas_Babington_Macaulay,_1st_Baron_Macaulay) - *"Q" Poison Island* - [Cambridge International Examinations](/wiki/Cambridge_International_Examinations) - "Constitution". *Singapore Institute of Food Science and Technology*. Archived from the original on June 17, 2005. Retrieved June 19, 2005. which requires that affiliate members must have passed the Senior Cambridge examination - "Victoria School history". *Ministry of Education Singapore*. Archived from the original on December 20, 2005. Retrieved June 19, 2005. - "About the school". *Cambridge School at Delhi*. Retrieved June 19, 2005. - "Education, International Schools in Singapore". Retrieved June 19, 2005. - "Brief History". *Montego Bay High School*. Archived from the original on March 10, 2005. Retrieved June 19, 2005.
title: Senior Cambridge
